0b7230a8-af7f-439d-8bf8-4d7a8482a836.description: At RBC, students gain on-the-job experience in a collaborative work environment. They get to work on real projects that provide hands-on experiences and deep insights into business operations. | À la RBC, les étudiants acquièrent une expérience de travail et ont accès à de la formation, et à un environnement de travail diversifié et collaboratif. Ils travaillent sur de vrais projets qui offrent des connaissances approfondies sur nos opérations commerciales.
0b7230a8-af7f-439d-8bf8-4d7a8482a836.name: RBC Work Experience - Summer 2021 | Expérience de travail RBC – Été 2021

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: EN: Backpack must be used to track all goals and performance reviews. To get the most out of your term and professional development, students should work with their manager in the first few weeks of the term to set 2 goals they want to achieve during their time at RBC. These goals should define what success looks like within the role by capturing job responsibilities and outlining personal goals above and beyond job accountabilities.
EN: At the end of the term, students must complete the Student Assessment on their own to reflect on the work they've done and the goals they've achieved.

EN: Your manager will review your student assessment and will complete a performance review with feedback which will later be visible to you. Students who have strong performance reviews are often considered for future opportunities at RBC.

FR: Backpack doit être utilisé pour suivre les objectifs et les évaluations de rendement. Pour tirer le meilleur du semestre, tous les étudiants doivent travailler avec leur gestionnaire au cours des premières semaines pour déterminer deux objectifs qu'ils souhaitent atteindre pendant leur séjour à la RBC. Ces objectifs doivent définir à quoi ressemble le succès dans le rôle en capturant les responsabilités professionnelles et en décrivant les objectifs personnels au-delà des tâches quotidiennes
FR: À la fin du semestre, les étudiants doivent compléter, par eux-mêmes, l’évaluation de l’étudiant pour réfléchir au travail qu'ils ont accompli et aux objectifs qu'ils ont atteints.

FR: Votre gestionnaire passera en revue votre évaluation et effectuera son évaluation de performance, en ajoutant des commentaires qui vous seront plus tard visibles. Les étudiants qui ont de bonnes évaluations de rendement sont souvent considérés pour des opportunités futures à RBC.

e3845682-8b0c-4375-8cc6-eeedabbd0cfc.description: At RBC, students gain on-the-job experience in a collaborative work environment. They get to work on real projects that provide hands-on experiences and deep insights into business operations. | À la RBC, les étudiants acquièrent une expérience de travail et ont accès à de la formation, et à un environnement de travail diversifié et collaboratif. Ils travaillent sur de vrais projets qui offrent des connaissances approfondies sur nos opérations commerciales.
e3845682-8b0c-4375-8cc6-eeedabbd0cfc.name: RBC Work Experience - Fall 2021 | Expérience de travail RBC – Automne 2021

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: EN: Backpack must be used to track all goals and performance reviews. To get the most out of your term and professional development, students should work with their manager in the first few weeks of the term to set 2 goals they want to achieve during their time at RBC. These goals should define what success looks like within the role by capturing job responsibilities and outlining personal goals above and beyond job accountabilities.
EN: At the end of the term, students must complete the Student Assessment on their own to reflect on the work they've done and the goals they've achieved.

EN: Your manager will review your student assessment and will complete a performance review with feedback which will later be visible to you. Students who have strong performance reviews are often considered for future opportunities at RBC.

FR: Backpack doit être utilisé pour suivre les objectifs et les évaluations de rendement. Pour tirer le meilleur du semestre, tous les étudiants doivent travailler avec leur gestionnaire au cours des premières semaines pour déterminer deux objectifs qu'ils souhaitent atteindre pendant leur séjour à la RBC. Ces objectifs doivent définir à quoi ressemble le succès dans le rôle en capturant les responsabilités professionnelles et en décrivant les objectifs personnels au-delà des tâches quotidiennes
FR: À la fin du semestre, les étudiants doivent compléter, par eux-mêmes, l’évaluation de l’étudiant pour réfléchir au travail qu'ils ont accompli et aux objectifs qu'ils ont atteints.

FR: Votre gestionnaire passera en revue votre évaluation et effectuera son évaluation de performance, en ajoutant des commentaires qui vous seront plus tard visibles. Les étudiants qui ont de bonnes évaluations de rendement sont souvent considérés pour des opportunités futures à RBC.

f0edde92-5176-496d-827a-8267b3e41375.description: Led by Olympian Sarah Wells, the Believe Impact Program is designed to give RBC students an opportunity to collaborate with like-minded individuals, further develop leadership skills, create an impact in the community, and showcase that impact to RBC leaders and industry experts. Participants are passionate about solving a similar issue. Together, participants collectively utilize their unique passions & skill sets to solve a problem, resulting in an Impact Project.
f0edde92-5176-496d-827a-8267b3e41375.name: Believe Impact Program Participant

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: As Participants in this program, students will work in teams of 8-10 of their peers to address a problem, build their project and create an impact. Participants dedicate a minimum of 2 hours per each week to attending team meetings and workshop sessions with Sarah Wells.

c3255d72-6093-4131-887f-014e6021c96d.description: Data literacy will be a critical skill set for the workplace of the future. This introductory learning program is the first step to building your data knowledge. Data 101 is intended for Data Novices and Data Practitioners.
c3255d72-6093-4131-887f-014e6021c96d.name: Data Literacy 101

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: A module-based learning course including introductory information relating to 6 key capabilities relating to Data Literacy - Data Analysis, Data Collection, Data Ethics, Data Management, Data Protection, Data Visualization.

d9d8b584-773a-4465-b1ca-b6a6e731aec1.description: RBC's Student Partner Program (SPP) positions selected students as leader within the large and diverse student community at RBC, over the course of a 4 month co-op or summer work term. Student Partners are enabled to function as mentors, responsible for building a sense of camaraderie among the student community, and to be a liaison between the students and the RBC Early Talent team. RBC's Student Partners have built strength in their leadership skills, creativity, and collaboration abilities.
d9d8b584-773a-4465-b1ca-b6a6e731aec1.name: RBC Student Partner

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: RBC Student Partners participate in a competitive selection process including an application and interview. The role of RBC Student Partner is a volunteer position that is above and beyond the students' mandate during their co-op or internship at RBC.

Student Partners are self-starters and ambitious leaders amongst their student peers across RBC. Throughout their term as Student Partners, students commit to activities including attending weekly meetings and student-related events, collaborating in teams, planning and executing tasks.

48ec962a-a1ae-40a8-891c-821d48eaa3b3.description: RBC works together with Ten Thousand Coffees to build networks between students, recent grads, and alumni. When you have a diverse network, it accelerates your career, allows you to tap into other professionals’ smart thinking, and helps answer important questions as you navigate current and future opportunities.
48ec962a-a1ae-40a8-891c-821d48eaa3b3.name: Networking Skills Development: Powered by Ten Thousand Coffees

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: Join the RBC Canada Student Café on Ten Thousand Coffees and start connecting with fellow students, alumni, and employees.
Have 3 separate coffee chats with individuals from the RBC Canada Student Café. These can be RBC employees that you match with, fellow students, or alumni.

14cf52bf-d2ef-4d85-834a-bcb67020817c.description: Led by Olympian Sarah Wells, the Believe Impact Program is an intensive 3 month program designed to give RBC students an opportunity to collaborate with like-minded individuals, further develop leadership skills, create an impact in the community, and showcase that impact to RBC leaders and industry experts. This badge is awarded to RBC Summer Students who took on the role of Team Lead for the program.
14cf52bf-d2ef-4d85-834a-bcb67020817c.name: Believe Impact Program Team Lead

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: As a Team Lead, students will lead a team of 8-10 RBC Summer Students and guide them through the development of an Impact Project. Team Leads dedicate a minimum of 3 hours per each week to leading their team through the project and participating in leadership development workshops with Olympian Sarah Wells.

20be8b6c-ff84-4f41-ad84-fe7bb87acf5d.description: The RBC Student Ambassador Program (SAP Program) is a volunteer program exclusively offered to existing students enrolled in post-secondary studies across Canada. Student Ambassadors take on the important role as chief liaison to their school upon return to their studies and completion of at least one co-op term with RBC. Ambassadors act as extension of the Early Talent Acquisition Team by sharing their experience with peers on campus via various events and initiatives.
20be8b6c-ff84-4f41-ad84-fe7bb87acf5d.name: RBC Student Ambassador Program

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: RBC Student Ambassador participate in a competitive selection process including an application and interview. The role of RBC Student Ambassador is a volunteer position that enable Ambassador to become student leader within their community.

A Student Ambassador is a key facet in upholding RBC’s impressive reputation and image amongst their peers. Students are tasked with the responsibility to communicate, organize, promote and participate in exciting RBC events and activities taking place on campus and entice their friends to join in on the action. Their aim is also to inspire their peers to explore the RBC brand and the countless array of opportunities available to them.

8c745f5f-6578-4345-bcba-908aff3fa3be.description: Data literacy will be a critical skill set for the workplace of the future. This intermediate learning program aims to build your data knowledge. Data 201 is intended for Data Practitioners or Data Experts.
8c745f5f-6578-4345-bcba-908aff3fa3be.name: Data Literacy 201

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: A module-based course including intermediate-level information relating to 6 key capabilities relating to Data Literacy - Data Analysis, Data Collection, Data Ethics, Data Management, Data Protection, Data Visualization. This course builds on knowledge gained in Data 101.

2e1f4d08-26d1-4b1a-8cb9-811d29481ccc.description: Students across different business lines at RBC come together to create RBC Learning Labs, courses that use RBC's knowledge by hosting community-designed curriculum to upskill our community and deliver tribal knowledge. Teams of students compete to create the most successful RBC Learning Labs with business value, design, adoption, collaboration, and overall content quality as success measures.
2e1f4d08-26d1-4b1a-8cb9-811d29481ccc.name: RBC InnerSource Innovation Challenge

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: In teams of 5, student colleagues from across RBC come together to design and implement RBC Learning Labs that shares tribal knowledge with other RBC employees. Teams must work collaboratively to build courses that are informative, clear, add business value, and support the enablement of RBC employees.

15444191-1aa8-4fad-b04f-ba9a729a9f7a.description: Core course centered around understanding the fundamentals of data science / AI with a core focus on how to recognize and qualify business use cases for AI/ML and how to set up a successful implementation.
15444191-1aa8-4fad-b04f-ba9a729a9f7a.name: Foundational Data Science for Business Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the required course materials that cover core areas designed to empower business leaders to understand and identify AI opportunities within the organization such as: core terminology & technology, recognizing & qualifying use cases and building an ML competency in their team(s).

4d2c7683-8d05-448b-ae03-6e75962a6c26.description: A module-based course including advanced-level information focused on the tools and applications related to each of the capabilities within Data Literacy - Data Analysis, Data Collection, Data Ethics, Data Management, Data Protection, Data Visualization. This course builds on knowledge gained in Data 101 and 201.
4d2c7683-8d05-448b-ae03-6e75962a6c26.name: Data Literacy 301

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the module-based course with advanced-level information focused on the tools and applications related to each of the capabilities within Data Literacy - Data Analysis, Data Collection, Data Ethics, Data Management, Data Protection, Data Visualization. This course builds on knowledge gained in Data 101 and 201.

0de3b745-6aa7-4cdb-9c10-447901271c99.description: Initial curriculum designed to provide fundamental skills for analysts that build a core competency in data science principles. Provides an understanding of general AI terms with an overview of statistics & linear algebra. Apply these concepts and overall analytical skills using python.
0de3b745-6aa7-4cdb-9c10-447901271c99.name: AI For Analysts - 101

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: A series of courses (20+ hrs) that was curated to cover foundational concepts & skills designed for business analysts. The curriculum covers: fundamental AI concepts, introductions to linear algebra & stats for analysts and programming in python for analysts.

9ceabe11-9dc4-47e9-beac-e7e3b66ce173.description: Initial curriculum designed to provide fundamental skills for developers that build a core competency in data science principles. Provides an understanding of general AI terms with an overview of statistics & linear algebra. Apply these concepts and overall analytical skills using python. Also see optional courses to continue to develop your skills in key platforms.
9ceabe11-9dc4-47e9-beac-e7e3b66ce173.name: AI For Developers - 101

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: A series of courses (25+ hrs) that was curated to cover foundational concepts & skills designed for developers at RBC. The curriculum covers: fundamental AI concepts, introductions to linear algebra & stats for analysts and programming in python for developers. Optional courses include: tensorflow, H2O, PyTorch and Time Series Analysis.

add9c664-4b06-46e1-9b3b-38715e1c4df1.description: Boost is a 6-month leadership & professional development program where technical New-Grads partake in monthly in-person training to build their communication, emotional intelligence, resiliency & confidence in the workplace, business acumen, strategic thinking, and leadership skills in order to become a stronger and more empathetic leader.
add9c664-4b06-46e1-9b3b-38715e1c4df1.name: T&O Boost - Leadership & Professional Development Program

issuer.summary: issued by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC)

badge_template_activities.title: New-Grad must apply to the Boost program (self-nomination) and receive manager approval to participate. Candidates must showcase an interest to development ones self, their communication skills, strategic thinking and leadership, as well as a willingness to learn.
